Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Doughy \Dough"y\ (d[=o]"[y^]), a. Like dough; soft and heavy; pasty; crude; flabby and pale; as, a doughy complexion. [1913 Webster]
doughy adj : having the consistency of dough because of insufficient leavening or improper cooking; "the cake fell; it's a doughy mess" [syn: {soggy}] [also: {doughiest}, {doughier}]
